text.text_translated: Zoos have an important modern job: supporting international breeding programmes, especially for species (kinds of animals) that are in danger of disappearing. In the wild, some of the rarest species (kinds of animals) find it difficult to get partners and have babies. They might also be in danger from poachers, losing their homes, and other animals that hunt them. A good zoo will let these species (kinds of animals) live and have babies in a safe place. In addition, when the number of some wild species (kinds of animals) drops, there is a bigger danger. The animals in these groups can become too similar because they have very similar genes. Breeding programmes give them protection. Animals born in zoos can be put back into the wild, which helps to make the groups have more different genes.
